TopicTitle: Epic KSP Theme song + Space theme (update 3)

Articles.Content:
Hey guys. I'm a progressive metal musician that plays KSP way too much, so I thought I'd give a go at covering the intro song in my style (which is epic orchestral progressive metal)!

Check it out.

Update 1/14/2014:

Pizzaoverhead has released a mod that allows you to replace music in Kerbal Space Program. Some of you have asked if there's a way to replace in the intro music with this song. Now you can!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65726-0-23-Soundtrack-Editor

At the moment, the mod requires sound files to be .ogg or .wav, so I am releasing a re-mastered version with an ogg file available. EDIT: I believe there is mp3 support now.

Remastered KSP Metal Intro Song:

Dropbox MP3: kspthemeR.mp3

Dropbox OGG: kspthemeR.ogg

Update 11/1/13:

Did a little bit of the space music:

https://soundcloud.com/bahamutod/kspspaceb1

Update 10/26/13:

New extended version with a little music video of random KSP clips.

Mp3 download:

http://www.sendspace.com/file/hv2sph

First version:

https://soundcloud.com/bahamutod/k-s-p-thememetal

Side question: Do you think it would be copyright infringement if I used it as an intro to my youtube ksp videos with ads?

Edited March 18, 2014 by BahamutoD

Haha metal KSP!

that was awesome. great project

Thanks fellas! Glad you liked it.

Not according to the composer. And that is -fluffy- metal!

I don't remember where I heard this but I thought that the intro was by Harvester, and not by Kevin MacLeod.

\m/ Yeah!!!

Thanks fellas! Glad you liked it.

I don't remember where I heard this but I thought that the intro was by Harvester, and not by Kevin MacLeod.

VÃƒÂ­ctor Machado

Maybe you should PM Harvester and ask for permission.
Okay, I admit I rolled my eyes at "prog metal cover" at first ... but, this is *good*. Well put together. Very tasty. Too short, if I had to find something I dislike about it.
Out of curiosity, why do people suddenly have low expectations when they see "prog metal" or "metal"?

Maybe because they feel that "metal" is 'trendy', and automatically expect run-of-the-mill, low quality product made by someone blindly following the trend? Which your piece definitely is not - i like it

Out of curiosity, why do people suddenly have low expectations when they see "prog metal" or "metal"?

Since it's your thread and you asked ... I lived in LA during the late 80's and 90's. I saw a *lot* of metal bands play (big names and bands you never heard of), so I am pretty jaded. I have not found very many modern metal bands that have any real musicality, so I don't bother with the genre. I could probably ramble on much more about the topic, but let's just leave it at that.
Makes sense. Anyways, I kept it short in case I wanted to use it as a short video intro, and tbh because I was too lazy to do the whole song and keep it interesting haha.

Somebody needs to make a replacer for the menu music. Now.

And call me crazy, but at times it reminds me of the Top Gun theme, which seems oddly fitting.
This was really good!
Great job!
Dude this is awesome! Nice work
That was most excellent

Constructive criticism mode on: I did not enjoy the muted sound of the "original" soundtrack in the beginning, because I felt it did not transition well into the bit where the guitars kicked in. In my opinion, it should either have started as crisp and loud as the metal bit, or it should have faded up to that. You may want to play with it and see what works best?

That said, the metal rendition of the KSP theme was nothing short of awesome. Very well done! That's the way I want to launch a rocket.

And a little nag at the end... I felt the outro dragged on for too long. A short piece like this benefits from a sharp, short end.

So my critique would be - you have a great piece of KSP music there, but I feel you could frame it better

When I first saw the title, I was not expecting much, but I loved it. Maybe my idea of metal is incorrect, I don't know, but to me this didn't feel like metal, but then I don't know much about music.

Also grats on getting onto KSP weekly! I wouldn't be here otherwise!

Now, I shall listen again.

Edit: I want this in KSP somewhere!!!

Edited October 23, 2013 by Merinsan

hm...

Your intro was somewhat annoying, Especially so with my EQ setup. after that, its good. The Outro carried on just a little bit too long. Cut it by ~ 6-8 seconds and your good, as far as I'm concerned.

Rock on brother!

Few things, I agreed with what has been said on the intro.

It would be great to have a proper full length version.

I NEED this in my game.
